Violation Description: Standard Provision B.17, Animal waste storage areas and containment structures shall be designed, constructed, and maintained to limit, to the greatest extent possible, infiltration, inundation, erosion, slope failure, washout, overtopping, by-pass, and overflow.

Primary wastewater storage lagoon with zero freeboard. Primary wastewater storage lagoon does not contain a freeboard / depth marker. Primary wastewater storage lagoon discharging wastewater and slurry manure off-property. Failure to manage wastewater/solid manure at the manure storage area and south of the manure storage area. Corral run-off discharging to cropland. StoringExcessive weeds on the primary and secondary wastewater storage lagoon embankments. wastewater and slurry manure on cropland.

Current violations including ponding in the corrals, freeboard requirements, and rodent holes, along with the discharge to cropland that happened the week prior. The discharge of corral wastewater to cropland is a violation of Dairy General Order Prohibition A.9. The ponding of wastewater in corrals and solid waste storage areas is a violation of Dairy General Order Production Area Specification D.6. The minimal amount of freeboard in the wastewater storage lagoon is a violation of Dairy General Order Pond Specification C.1. The excessive rodent holes in the embankments of the wastewater storage lagoon and settling basin are a violation of Dairy General Order Specification B.1 and MRP, A, Table 1.
Comments: Discharger has to address all issues., notify staff and staff will reinspect.
Corrective Action: 1. Immediately discontinue non-nutrient recycling discharges of wastewater with manure constituents from corrals to cropland. 2. Regrade corrals or install infrastructure to promote wastewater drainage to the lagoon by no later than 28 June 2023; notify staff and staff will reinspect. 3. Immediately increase the freeboard within the ponds to be greater than 2 feet. 4. Abate burrowing animals from lagoon embankments and repair/backfill defects on lagoon embankments

Violation Description: Excessive vegetation/weeds inside the settling basin.
Comments: Remove excessive vegetation/weeds. Provide photos of the settling basin after the weeds have been removed.

Violation Description: Discharge of wastewater from tailwater pond. Minimal amount of freeboard in the wastewater Storage lagoon.
Comments: Repair tailwater pond. Provide proof of repaired tailwater pond. Achieve the required freeboard in the storage lagoon. Provide proof of required freeboard.

Violation Description: Off-Property Wastewater Discharge. Uncontained corral runoff flowing off-property
Comments: Immediately stop discharging wastewater off-property and direct wastewater runoff to your wastewater storage ponds.

Violation Description: Off-Property Wastewater Discharge. Using former fishponds for manure wastewater storage that are not considered existing or meet the Tier I/Tier II criteria. Disposal of manure wastewater on cropland for purposes other than nutrient recycling
Corrective Action: By the Due Date, drain/dewater former fishponds and cease using them for wastewater storage.

Responsible Party: California Polytechnic State University - San Luis Obispo
Place (Facility): California Polytechnic University, Confined Animal Waste
Violation Type: Water Quality -> Receiving Water -> Surface Water
Violation Description: As a direct result of the recent series of atmospheric river events, Cal Poly experienced an overflow from the Dairy Unit wastewater storage lagoon operated under WDR Order R3-2003-35. The overflow began at approximately 12:15 on January 9th, 2023. Flow discharged through a designed relief overflow outlet at the south-east end of the primary dairy lagoon and through a series of stormwater drainage conveyances which ultimately terminate at Stenner Creek, a tributary to San Luis Obispo Creek. The discharge was reported to the California Office of Emergency Services at 13:45 (report ID 23-0251). Report of the event was also made to the Central Coast Regional Water Quality Control Board via email at 14:04. The approximate volume released from the lagoon was 53,058 gallons.
Failure to submit the 2022 Annual Report by 1 July 2022

Responsible Party: Ajmail Singh Sangha and Parajmeet Kour Sangha
Place (Facility): Former F and J Delano Dairy
Violation Description: Failure to submit the 2022 Annual Report.

All process wastewater applied to land application areas must infiltrate completely within 72 hours after application. Weeds shall be minimized through control of water depth, harvesting, or other appropriate method.

On February 23, 2024, at approximately 10:45 AM, Santa Ana Water Board staff observed liquid discharging on to Eucalyptus Avenue from a containment pond located at Gordon Dairy #4. The liquid appeared to flow west on Eucalyptus Avenue to Bon View Avenue.
Standing wastewater at the northeast and central portions of the livestock corrals and at the manure storage/drying areas is a violation of Production Area Specification D.6.
Corrective Action: Submit a description of the measures that have been taken to assure wastewater will be conveyed in the future to the wastewater retention system within 72 hours following a storm event.

Violation Description: The Waste Management Plan has not been updated to reflect existing conditions at the Dairy, notably the expansion of the production area by the addition of the manure drying area.
Comments: As a result, the 2014 Revised Waste Management Plan does not provide an accurate estimate of required wastewater capacity. This is a violation of Required Reports and Requirements J.1.B.
Corrective Action: Submit an engineering report assessing whether the wastewater retention system has sufficient capacity to retain the wastewater generated during the Order designated storage period.

Violation Description: Standing water observed at the northwest livestock corrals more than 72 hours following a storm event is a violation of Production Area Specification D.6.
Corrective Action: Submit a description of the measures that have been taken to assure wastewater will be conveyed in the future to the wastewater retention system within 72 hours following a storm event.

Violation Description: Mixed manure and animal carcass remains noted at the borrow pit represent inappropriate mortality management practices.
Comments: Disposal of dead animals at the Dairy is a violation of Prohibition A.6 and the Operations and Maintenance Plan for the Dairy.
Corrective Action: Submit documentation that mixed manure and animal carcass remains have been appropriately disposed.

Violation Description: Wastewater within the borrow pit more than 72 hours following a storm event is a violation of Production Area Specification D.6.
Corrective Action: Submit documentation that standing wastewater, residual manure, and manure affected soils have been removed from the borrow pit and either conveyed to the wastewater retention system or appropriately used for nutrient recycling.

Violation Description: Erosion along the sidewall of the wastewater storage pond is a violation of Standard Provisions and Reporting Requirements (SPRR), Provision B.17 and inconsistent with the Operations and Maintenance Plan (O&M Plan) prepared for the Dairy.
Comments: The noted condition represents a violation of Standard Provisions and Reporting Requirements (SPRR), Provision B.17 and inconsistent with the Operations and Maintenance Plan (O&M Plan) prepared for the Dairy, as required by Attachment B, Waste Management Plan for the Production Area, Paragraph V.B.

Violation Description: Manure and wastewater appear to have been applied within a declared land application area northwest of the production area and non-production area south of the production area at non-agronomic rates, in violation of Prohibition A.9, which prohibits land application of manure or process wastewater for purposes other than nutrient recycling.

A Priority Reporting of Significant Events (PROSE) notification of noncompliance with Prohibition A.9 (cited above) was not provided within 24 hours of becoming aware of its occurrence, nor was a written report submitted within two weeks of its occurrence, in violation of the MRP, Section C, Reporting Requirements.
Failure to submit a revised Flood Study as requested in 19 June 2018 Inspection Report, in violation of Required Reports and Notices J.1.b.
Failure to submit a new Report of Waste Discharge (RWD) for the expansion of the Dairy’s Production Area

Updated Waste Management Plan is required to be maintained, backflow prevention to surface water is required. 2 feet of freeboard is required in wastewater storage ponds, stormwater sampling is required to be performed.
Failure to submit the 2022 Annual Report in accordance with Water Code Section 13267, Provisions H.4 of Order R5-2017-0058.
The 2011 WMP shows the Dairy doesn’t meet the required storage capacity

Wastewater surrounding sump pump #2. The area requires maintenance to assess the integrity of the tank. During the inspection, staff observed a possible broken tank or broken piping, within overgrown and saturated grass, in standing water. Board Order No. 6-96-9, section No. I.C.1., states that “Surface flow or visible discharge of manure at, or from, the authorized disposal site to adjacent land areas or surface waters is prohibited.”
Comments: Staff observed water pondage around the sump pump-tank equipment that receives wash water from the wash pen prior to entering the milking parlor. This saturated grass-weed area poses a threat to groundwater quality as it percolates to the ground since the liquid waste contains urine, and organic solids.
Corrective Action: The Discharger stated that the situation would get fixed by repairing any leakage occurring either in the sub-surface tank or in the appurtenances compatible to the equipment. No date was committed for this issue to get repaired.

Violation Description: Water Board staff observed standing water in a corral flowing from a drinking water trough. The observed water stream did not flow towards the concrete channel that allows storm water and liquid manure to flow to the storm water impoundment; rather, the stream flowed away from the channel and towards the inside of the corral. This standing water threatens the potential to percolate to groundwater. Board Order No. 6-96-9, section No. I.C.6., states that, “Manured areas shall be managed to minimize infiltration of water into underlying soils.”
Comments: From the previous inspection on January 20, 2023, staff observed large puddles of water within the vicinity of the water trough after a rain event that had recently occurred. At the time of that inspection, staff advised the discharger of the water puddles accumulated within the corral nearby the water trough. Staff advised the Discharger that standing water in the corrals are prohibited and that liquid waste from the corrals must flow to the concrete channel that leads to the storm water impoundment. The water observed in the same location within the corral and water trough during the September 26, 2024 inspection implies that the Discharger did not mitigate the situation to allow liquid waste to flow into the concrete channel and eventually to the storm water impoundment; thus the violation.
Corrective Action: As of January 20, 2023, the Discharger has not implemented or proposed any corrective actions.

An engineering report demonstrating that the capacity of the wastewater retention system at the Dairy is sufficient to retain all wastewater generated, together with all precipitation on and drainage through manured areas, up to and including a 25-year, 24-hour storm event, has not been submitted as required by Attachment B, Section II and Schedule of Tasks J.1 and Table 1.

Plant tissue sample results for four crops were not included in the 2020 Annual Report, which is a violation of the MRP, Table 2, Nutrient Monitoring. The 2023 Annual Report submitted on 26 June 2024 was reviewed and showed corrected nutrient monitoring practices. This violation has been resolved.

Laboratory analyses for general minerals were not documented within the last five years, as required by the MRP, Table 4, Groundwater Monitoring, Domestic and Agricultural Supply Wells. The 2023 Annual Report submitted on 18 June 2024 was reviewed and showed laboratory analyses for general mineral samples were done on 7 February 2024. This violation has been resolved.

Laboratory analyses for electric conductivity were not documented for 2021, as required by the MRP, Table 4, Groundwater Monitoring, Domestic and Agricultural Supply Wells. The 2023 Annual Report submitted on 18 June 2024 was reviewed and showed laboratory analyses for electric conductivity samples were done on 7 February 2024. This violation has been resolved.
Irrigation wells had insufficient backflow prevention in the form of an air gap, in violation of Prohibition A.12.
An insufficient Nutrient Management Plan was produced during the inspection process, in violation of Land Application Area Specifications A.1 and Attachment D of the Digester General Order
The Dairy was utilizing low spots and manure drying are as solid separating basins that were not declared as wastewater ponds, in violation of Prohibitions A.4.

Responsible Party: Vanden Berg Old River Investment Company Inc(+)
Violation Description: Third quarter wastewater sample results were not documented in the 2021 Annual Report, fourth quarter wastewater samples results were not documented in the 2022 Annual Report, second and third quarter wastewater sample results were not included in the 2023 Annual Report, and biennial wastewater sample results for general minerals were not documented in the 2022 through 2023 Annual Reports, which is a violation of the MRP, Table 2, Nutrient Monitoring, Process Wastewater. Fourth quarter 2023 wastewater sample results were included in the 2023 Annual Report resolving the violation for the wastewater sample results from fourth quarter 2022. According to Jim Griffin (consultant for the Dairy), the remaining wastewater sample results are not available.

Responsible Party: Vanden Berg Old River Investment Company Inc(+)
Violation Description: Manure sample results were not included in the 2022 Annual Report, and biennial manure sample results for general minerals were not documented in the 2022 through 2023 Annual Reports, which is a violation of the MRP, Table 2, Nutrient Monitoring, Manure. Manure sample results were included in the 2023 Annual Report resolving the violation for the 2022 manure sample results. According to Jim Griffin, the biennial manure results for 2022 through 2023 are not available.

Responsible Party: Vanden Berg Old River Investment Company Inc(+)
Violation Description: Stormwater inspection records were not available for review, which is a violation of the MRP, Table 1, Inspections, Production Area. According to Jim Griffin, stormwater inspection records are not available.

The Dairy added a manure storage area outside the production area defined in the Dairy’s revised Waste Management Plan. Failure to submit a Report of Waste Discharge (ROWD) with appropriate technical documentation at least 140 days prior to expanding the Dairy’s production area is a violation of Provision G.4. On 17 January 2025, Garrison Fernandes of Livingston Dairy Consulting, Inc. (LDC) submitted an updated Nutrient Management Plan accounting for the manure storage area.

Excessive vegetation was observed at Retention Ponds 1 and 2, which is a violation of Pond Specification C.2.b and is inconsistent with the Operations and Maintenance Plan prepared for the Dairy, as required by Attachment B, Waste Management Plan for the Production Area, Item V.B.

A setback plan to prevent the application of Dairy waste to cropland within 100 feet of groundwater wells and surface water bodies was not available for review, which is a violation of General Specification B.7 and Standard Provisions and Reporting Requirement B.18.

A setback plan to prevent the application of Dairy waste to cropland within 100 feet of groundwater wells and surface water bodies was not available for review, which is a violation of General Specification B.7 and Standard Provisions and Reporting Requirement B.18.

Excessive vegetation was observed along the sidewalls of the wastewater settling ponds, which is a violation of Pond Specification C.2.b and is inconsistent with the Operations and Maintenance Plan prepared for the Dairy, as required by Attachment B, Waste Management Plan for the Production Area, Item V.B. Staff made several attempts to obtain the necessary information to resolve this violation.

The Dairy added a feed storage area outside the production area defined in the Dairy’s Waste Management Plan Addendum. Failure to submit a Report of Waste Discharge (ROWD) with appropriate technical documentation at least 140 days prior to expanding the Dairy’s production area is a violation of Provision G.4. Subsequent to the inspection, I provided Brandon Wininger of Sentry Ag Services, LLC (consultant for the Dairy) with a map showing the feed storage area.
Excessive vegetation was observed in the south wastewater pond in violation of Pond Specification C.2.b.
Ponding was observed in corrals with manure more than 72-hours after a precipitation event in violation of Production Area Specifications D.6 and Item V.F. of Attachment B.
The Dairy has expanded the Production Area footprint without providing a Report of Waste Discharge in violation of Provisions G.4.
The land application area south of the wastewater ponds received Dairy waste for non-nutrient recycling in violation of Prohibition A.9.
A Priority Report for Significant Events (PROSE) report was not submitted in accordance to Section C of the Monitoring and Reporting Program in conjunction with Violation 5.

Responsible Party: Pete and Agnes de Jong Family Trust
Violation Description: General mineral analytical results for wells Barn, 1-Griffith, and 2-Cow were not documented in the 2019 through 2023 Annual Reports, which is a violation of the MRP, Table 4, Groundwater Monitoring. On 19 December 2024, Marlene Ferreira of Livingston Dairy Consulting, Inc. (LDC) provided general mineral analytical results from groundwater samples collected from wells Barn, 1-Griffith, and 2-Cow in 2024. This violation has been resolved.

Groundwater sample analyses were not documented in the 2020 Annual Report and for well WSD W5 in the 2022 Annual Report, which is a violation of the MRP, Table 4, Groundwater Monitoring. According to information provided in the 2020 Annual Report, analytical results for the missing groundwater samples are not available. The groundwater sample results for well WSD W5 were not included in the 2023 Annual report.

C. 2.: Pond Specifications; Ponds shall be managed and maintained to prevent breeding of mosquitoes and other vectors. In particular, b. Weeds shall be minimized through control of water depth, harvesting, or other appropriate method; c. Dead algae, vegetation, and debris shall not accumulate on the water surface
Waste applications to crops grown at the Dairy fields, as indicated by the 2020, 2021, 2022, and 2023 Annual Reports, have resulted in nitrogen balance ratios in excess of 1.65.
Comments: Nutrient applications resulting in nitrogen balance ratios in excess of 1.65 are in violation of Land Application Specification E.5.a and Attachment C, Technical Standards for Nutrient Management, Nutrient Application Rates, Nitrogen, section B.2.b.

Violation Description: The Dairy added a manure storage area outside the production area defined in Dairy’s revised Waste Management Plan. Failure to submit a Report of Waste Discharge (ROWD) with appropriate technical documentation at least 140 days prior to expanding the Dairy’s production area is a violation of Provision G.4. On 24 February 2025, Ms. Medeiros emailed a completed ROWD Form 200, an updated Nutrient Management Plan (NMP) signed by a certified crop advisor, and a letter stating that Mariann Cardoso was retained and will be finalizing the review for the Waste Management Plan (WMP) by the end of the month. On 7 March 2025, Ms. Medeiros emailed an updated WMP signed by and certified with the stamp of Manuel R. Sousa, a California Registered Civil Engineer. This violation has been resolved.

Excessive vegetation growth was observed along the sidewalls of the wastewater storage ponds. Pond Specifications C.2.b and C.2.c require the control of vegetation to provide vector control and maintain pond functional capacity.
Laboratory analyses for general minerals were not documented within the last five years, as required by the MRP, Table 4, Groundwater Monitoring, Domestic and Agricultural Supply Wells.
Excessive vegetation was observed in the wastewater pond in violation of Pond Specifications C.6.b.

C. 2., Pond Specifications: The Confined Bovine Feeding Operation shall have facilities that are designed, constructed, operated, and maintained to retain all wastewater generated during the storage period (maximum period of time anticipated between land applications of wastewater), together with all precipitation on and drainage through manured areas, up to and including during a 25-year, 24-hour storm (see Section B of Attachment B, which is attached to and made part of this Order). Attachment B. B. An engineering report demonstrating that the facility has adequate containment capacity.
Comments: Waste Management Plan shows facility does not have capacity to retain all facility wastewater generated, together with all precipitation on and drainage through manured areas, up to and including during a 25-year, 24-hour storm.

Violation Description: Pond Specifications C.4. In the Tulare Lake Basin, Confined Bovine Feeding Operations in operation on or before 25 July 1975 shall be protected from inundation or washout from overflow from any stream channel during 20-year peak stream flows and Confined Bovine Feeding Operations constructed after 25 July 1975 shall be protected from 100-year peak stream flows. Confined Bovine Feeding Operations that were expanded after 8 December 1984 shall be protected from 100-year peak stream flows.
Comments: Required Reports and Notices K.1.C. Waste Management Plan: ""...The Waste Management Plan shall provide an evaluation of the Confined Bovine Feeding Operation's design, construction, operation, and maintenance for flood protection and waste containment and whether the facility complies with Prohibition A.14 (backflow prevention on wells), Pond Specifications C.2 through C.4 (flood protection),...""
Corrective Action: Proposed modifications or improvements in the WMP with the corresponding design to achieve the necessary flood protection and a schedule for construction and certification of completion to comply with the Schedule of Tasks M.1 of the Bovine General Order.
